node.title: Energy Australia charged over worker's power station death
node.alt: A power station sending plumes of discharge into the sky.
node.description: WorkSafe has charged Energy Australia with three breaches of the Occupational Health and Safety Act over the 2018 death of Graeme Edwards, who was fatally burnt while working at the Latrobe Valley power station.
node.content: ["WorkSafe has charged\u00a0Energy Australia with three breaches of the Occupational Health and Safety Act over the 2018 death of Graeme Edwards, who was fatally burnt while working at the\u00a0Latrobe Valley power station.", "It is a backflip from the Victorian\u00a0regulator, which announced\u00a0in November last year that\u00a0the company would not face any charges over the\u00a0death, much to the disgust of Mr Edwards's friends, colleagues and unions, who called for a review.", "Today's decision comes after\u00a0a review by the Office of Public Prosecutions.", "Mr Edwards, 54, died when he was badly burnt in an electrical short circuit while performing routine maintenance at the Morwell plant on November 12, 2018.", "An internal investigation by\u00a0Energy Australia\u00a0found Mr Edwards was doing his job exactly as he had been trained, but the source of the high voltage power had not been adequately barricaded to protect workers.", "More to come.\u00a0"]
